pr_title: Fix SetSingleNodeAllocateStep for data tier deployments

timeline.message:
Fix SetSingleNodeAllocateStep for data tier deployments

When the `shrink` action in ILM chooses a random node to assign the shards to, it checks the
`FilterAllocationDecider` to see whether the node can hold the shards (looping through all nodes
until it can find one that can hold them). A previous implementation of data tier allocation used
`FilterAllocationDecider`, but the current one uses a custom decider: `DataTierAllocationDecider`.
This decider needs to be used within the `SetSingleNodeAllocateStep` so that the shrink action
doesn't attempt to allocate an index with the "data_warm" preference to a node with the "data_hot"
role.

This commit adds this decider and a test to exhibit the behavior.
